Reviews.Title: No more touch screens!
Reviews.Author: kariem87
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. I am not a fan of touch screen phones, but I did want a smart phone. The Blackberry Bold is the perfect mix. It has a touch pad (kind of like a laptop) instead of the dreaded touch screen. This is my first Blackberry and I am surprised how fast it is. I had read a lot of bad reviews about Blackberry,that it had a short battery life, constant freezing and other gripes. Yes, the phone has a short battery life if you are on it 24/7 (but what would you expect with a smart phone) If you use it moderately it will last much longer. I do have to charge it every night, but that is the price of technology. I have experienced some freezing but my computer does that too, so it is not a big deal. I would recommend this phone to anyone who wants to break away from the touch screens.

Then I learned that not all blackberry phones, although being unlocked, work with all providers. In my country , CLARO (the company who provides service to the mayority) does not work with smartphones made for Verizon or Sprint. You should buy one made for AT&T.; It is a problem of compatibility, you will be able to make and receive calls, but no internet or bb messenger. Happily I bought my cell from a serious company (Orderdirect), and right now they have exchanged my phone with one I can use. Hope to receive the new one in a few days.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone, Bad Seller.
Reviews.Author: Purchaser
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I needed a non camera phone for my job. The seller (OEM Store) claimed that it would be shipped with instructions on how to change the settings for GSM use and how to download the Service Books for At&t; and T-mobile GSM services (MMS, Internet, etc.) None of this was included with the shipment, although the phone did work on my GSM service, only after I searched the web for a while to find the information that I needed.The phone itself is exactly what you would expect from a blackberry bold, the phone shipped with OS 5, but it was quick and easy to upgrade it to OS 6 through the blackberry desktop software. (even though this phone is a Verizon CDMA phone, it still upgraded through the desktop software with an AT&T; sim card active)Although this phone works perfectly fine on the Verizon CDMA 3G networks, this phone DOES NOT work on GSM 3G networks, however it does work on the EDGE and GPRS networks (2G). The charger included is not the standard blackberry USB to Mini USB cord charger, its a regular Mini USB to wall charger, so connecting to your PC or Mac for the desktop software isn't straight out of the box. Also, the phones manual is not included nor the desktop software install disc, you will have to download the latest version of the desktop software from blackberry's website.

Ofertan un producto "nuevo" y no viene en la caja original de BLACKBERRY, y de paso no esta desbloqueado. Tomare als acciones legales pertinentes en USA. Exijo de Amazon, empresa intermediaria y portal de compras la colaboracion necesaria para la devolucion inmediata del dinero pagado pro esta basura que me han enviado. Asi mismo agradezco me hagan llegar via email, los pasos necesarios para la devolucion inmediata de esta mercancia en virtud de sentirme estafada.

Reviews.Title: It's a great phone unless you compare it to iPhone...
Reviews.Author: Larisa L. Marr
Reviews.Content: It's a great phone unless you compare it to iPhone... I loved it for a while mainly for business purposes like fast e-mail and messaging. The other features like camera, calendar and etc were rather difficult to use, not as easy. Then also it would crash ones in a while when I start one or the other application... It has its pluses like the beautiful sleek design and the screen, but it also has lots of minuses as well. Needles to say, I have switched to an iPhone. I am super happy now. Never even knew - what the heck took me so long, should have done it sooner. But I know there are some Blackberry lovers out there. This phone performs well up to the point you start comparing it to the iPhone...PS. I noticed that many people placed their 1 star review to this phone simply because they had a bad experience buying this phone from some of the "bad" sellers here on Amazon. This is completely unfair. The phone is more like 3-4 stars. It DOES have a camera. I don't understand why some people say they received their Blackberry without camera in it. They should probably read the exact description of the item more carefully. Because if you do buy it "used", then you have to pay very careful attention to that item's particular description. Every seller is supposed to give a detailed description.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE UPGRADES
Reviews.Author: Margaux Paschke
Reviews.Content: This is the second Blackberry phone owned and my husband uses it for business.  He mocks my iPhone and swears by this Blackberry.  If you are looking for a more business oriented phone, this one leads the pack.THE GOOD:The biggest improvements are: (1) international service and (2) the glide pad button instead of the trackball on older models.  The glide pad button works much better since the trackball would get dirty and stick with no real way of cleaning it to fix the problem.  There are plenty more apps available with this phone, understanding that it cannot compete with Android or Apple on this point.  The Blackberry still shines for business related work and easy to use keyboard over the touch screen versions.  The phone has been banged around and keeps on working.  Gotta love that!  Phone service is provided by Verizon and there have been no problems with dropped calls.THE BAD:(1) Not too happy about it ranking high on the radiation list for cellphones.

Reviews.Title: Blackberry 9650
Reviews.Author: Esther B
Reviews.Content: It a constant race to keep up with the new phones and different versions. I have had the blackberry 9650 for about a year and four months now and its time to say, I'm ready for a new phone! When the phone first arrived all was well, but within a few months little problems would turn into minor problems. Now I'm forced to keep this phone that comes with a two year contract and deal with its mood swings such as shutting off randomly.  Anticipating the arrival for the phone was something words cannot express because it seemed like the best thing on the market. Trying to set up the phone took me the whole night but it was worth it to me, and since everyone I knew had a blackberry it became the "thing". The keys were so small that my thumbs had to adjust but it became easy over time. The company had sent me a charger that was able to swap the sockets, but it was useless to me because I never even needed the extra. The memory on the phone is terrible, I'm constant deleting things to make room for more things and thats a loss for me which I don't like. However, it lets me keep in contact with people in various different ways which I thought was cool and insightful at the same time. The screen protector that came with it broke and it was a good accessory for the phone, and also the headphones which broke too.  The phone does the job of what its supposted to do which is the most important thing to me, but always waiting for it to load and reboot itself makes me not want to be bothered with it anymore. I wouldn't mind another blackberry use a more upgraded version with more memory and lots of new featuers. I'll make a decision when my contract is up wheater to continue the blackberry line or get the new iphone and be ahead of the race again.

Reviews.Title: I should have known better
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: Having had a Blackberry Curve previously, and being frustrated with it, I should've known better when I upgraded to the 9650. Right out of the box, the trackpad button was installed crooked. I took it back immediately and was told by the Sprint technician, "yup, it's crooked, nothing we can do about it, RIM shipped thousands like that". And so began nearly a year of frustration with this deeply flawed device. Six months into using it, the device suddenly began turning itself off for no reason, usually just when I was using the browser. I took it back for repair, and they marginally fixed it, though it continued to shut down on occasion. The crooked trackpad continued to impede navigation throughout my usage. When they upgraded the operating system during the shut-down repair, I had hoped for better performance. Instead, it just slowed the phone down even more. As I travel to rural areas often, I need a phone that can also function minimally as a web browser - and this is where this phone really fails. Mobile media pages load with excruciating slowness, if at all. The camera image quality is also very poor, and the rudimentary controls are clunky and primitive. After less than a year I had enough and purchased at full price an HTC Android phone, and love it. Clearly, RIM has no clue about the current smartphone paradigm; the Blackberry line is a thing of the past, and the 9650 is an overpriced piece of junk, useful only as a phone, and marginally for messaging. Buyer beware.

He tried to get me to activate another service to get a phone for cheap but I've been down that road before. Pretty much my heart sank and I am upset with Amazon and PutGroup for misleading me. Even the pictures of the phone Amazon is advertising shows that it has a little Verizon logo on the phone. Now I am out a phone for another week and it's hurting my personal life as well as my business (I'm a General COntractor). Amazon, you need to make it explicitly clear what type of phone service provider the phone is compatible with so this doesn't happen to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: It Lasted About Six Months
Reviews.Author: Frank  M.
Reviews.Content: My wife liked the phone OK, however, the Micro USB connector of the charger was very flimsy, it would not even enter all the way into the phone.  Needless to say, after a while she had to connect multiple times, before the phone would charge.  Finally, no matter what she did the phone no longer accepted any charge, it was dead.  The phone has a two years warranty in the USA and Canada, and Amazon, being the company it is, replaced the phone without any argument to speak of.  Also, the replacement phone came without the special wall plug adapter the phone had, in order to fit our US wall outlets.  The replacement phone's Micro-USB of the charger fits much better, but no longer provides a USB connection to the desktop computer, as the previous one had.  We use T-Mobile, and I can send new contacts, from my desktop, to the phone with our Wi-Fi service, so this is not an issue.We hope the replacement phone performs better; we shall see as time goes by.

Reviews.Title: Not for Verizon service
Reviews.Author: Kay Little
Reviews.Content: We had to send this back as it would not work on our Verizon service.  It is advertised as unlocked for GSM.  What it did not say is that it was locked for CDMA phones and cannot be unlocked except for a specific carrier.  We needed it to work for our Verizon service, but the one they sent was locked for Sprint.  There should be a place on the form to indicate what service you would like to use the phone on, so they can pick the correct CDMA for your particular network.  Or explain the differences between GSM and CDMA.

Reviews.Title: Trying to be balanced
Reviews.Author: JMPP
Reviews.Content: The features of this product are okay. But the hardware is really terrible. The whole phone, not just the battery, gets hot for no apparent reason. This in turn drains the battery. I discovered that many owners of BlackBerry Bold phones had the same issues when I tried to find a solution to these problems. Only 10 days after I started using this product, the battery won't charge anymore after the phone got hot by itself without being used. At times it would also shut down by itself when I tried to surf on the internet. It's unbelievable that this product is still being sold with such huge defects - not just bugs but dinosaurs.Few apps seem to be available in comparison with other brands. After getting this phone, I felt I had something that would soon become an antique. Do yourself a favor, don't buy this phone. I am returning mine. BB Bold, bye bye.

Reviews.Title: NOT "New"
Reviews.Author: Missbruingal "Workoutgal"
Reviews.Content: This company has also gone by the name of "Cell Lounge" and, why they have great customer service, the products they sell as "New" are anything but. Over the course of my dealings with them, I had 3 different devices in my possession (unacceptable phone, not unlocked, etc) and one thing was for absolute certain; NONE OF THEM WERE NEW. If you are okay with rolling the dice and trying to get a phone that will last until you are eligible for an upgrade on your carrier, then take a chance. But if you are looking for a "new" and longer lasting phone (at least 2-3 years) than do not buy a phone online....from any company, in my opinion. They are NOT new. There was a distinct discoloration on all of the white screens on the last phone that I had through Cell Lounge (now a name change) and then it flipped out and would not re-boot itself at all, rendering it useless. But I will say that this company knows full well that they are peddling inferior products and are willing to replace or refund your money. So, if you are willing to take a chance on an online phone purchase, try these guys because if/when the phone stops working properly, they will refund your money (or replace it, should you want to try AGAIN.) That is why I gave them a "2-star" instead of a 1-star (due to defective merchandise).

Reviews.Title: Brief overview
Reviews.Author: Mr "A"
Reviews.Content: It is great, easy to use and quite portable as it fits in the breast pocket of all my shirts. I have set the morning alarm to wake me up everyday at 6:00 AM and turned off at 1:00 AM every morning to allow me sleep without any disturbance. I schedule my appointment dates in it. In fact, it acts as a mini computer for me since I am able to check my e-mails and also internet services where ever I find myself. It keeps me busy when idleling around by reading a variety of things ranging from news to international events.  Of all the cell phones I have had this is the best so far. When I put it on speaker I am able to multi task while still talking to the person at the other end.  Over all it is a good piece of material I have ever acquired.

Reviews.Title: Desilucionada
Reviews.Author: laurhect
Reviews.Content: El envió fue rápido y excelente, pero no estoy a gusto con el equipo me siento defraudada!!!!!!1) Es cierto que el equipo esta liberado pero este equipo nevega en 3G para tecnologia CDMA y en 2G para tecnologia GSM, cosa que no aclaran en la publicación.2) Por otro lado me llamo mucho la atención, que la caja y el equipo no tienen por ningún lado los seriales, datos de PIN, IMEI y otros que sueles ver en cualquier móvil blackberry, de hecho ni en el interior del móvil están los seriales!!! Cosa que me alarmo y sinceramente, me hace dudar de la calidad del equipo, la cual, decae al tratar(porque aun no logro usarlo, dado tantas fallas.3) El tracpack, no funciona bien!!!! baja o sube cuando quiere, no puedo acceder a las aplicaciones,es decir tengo teléfono cuando y para lo que el celular lo permite, ni la fecha puedo aun cambiar porque se me hace imposible llegar a las funciones.4) Viene con el idioma INGLES Y FRANCES, se re inicia solo!!!5) La batería NO RINDE!!! (PARA MI ESTA DEFECTUOSA O EL CARGADOR)6) NO LO PUEDO USARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR, EL TRACPACK NO ME DEJA @:Cuando realice la compra, mis expectativas eran buenas, vivo en Venezuela y no es primera vez que realizo compra por este medio,EXITOSAS!!!! pero lamentablemente, esta compra es una total perdida!!!!! Pregunto como solucionamos este caso??? Que paso?????, porque junto a este móvil también, compre el 9105, y no se me presentaron todos esto inconvenientes (solo el idioma y 3g)Ojala y mi lamentable experiencia, sirva para prevenir futuros incidentes de este tipo, en especial para los compradores (como mi caso) fuera de USA :(

These elements were unopcional of 25 dollars, I pay with my credit card, now the order came without those elements, whether lost or not what happened, but I cheated!It is the amount of money, lack of accountability that prevents me to buy again from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: RIM Does it again with the Bold 9650
Reviews.Author: Cav
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 Blackberrys now and this one really takes the cake. The new touch-sensitive button that replaced the trackball is something that takes getting used to after really enjoying the feel of the gliding ball to scroll through text and pages. However...once you do get used to it, it makes a world of a difference. The pad is more sensitive (which is of course customizable through the Blackberry menu), works better, doesn't clog up with dirt and need to be cleaned like the old ones, and is overall very sleek in design.The phone boasts Wi-Fi and GSM/CDMA network capability, Bluetooth (which might I recommend the Audio Gateway?BlackBerry Bluetooth Stereo Gateway), a long-lasting battery (5 hours constant talk time), sleek design, tight security options for business, push e-mail and push notifications, full QWERTY keyboard, Large (2.45") high-resolution display (480 x 360 resolution at 245 ppi) and finally a full HTML browser. I forgot to mention that the Blackberry Messaging (BBM) system is far ahead of the others-you can see when the other person is typing, when they got the message, when they read the message, and its all free world-wide. Best "texting" application on the market, it really is unbeatable!Blackberry is really stepping it up with this phone and general, the Blackberry App World is increasing by the minute with great new apps for your phone like Pandora and it comes standard with MS Office word to go and others.The new operating system just released about 2 months ago and they have made great strides with their messaging and email system, the layout and buttons, customizing and so much more. I have never had a phone with so many options to make the phone MINE. Everything from themes, custom LED colors, different tones/vibes for every contact to completely changeable and movable screen icons.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, with few manageable issues
Reviews.Author: Nitsiey
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm pleased with what I have received. Honestly speaking, I made a brave attempt to buy this product even after seeing negative reviews but after receiving the product I realized what people are complaining about.Here is my take on this: At about 180$ if you receive an unlocked outdated model with few issues which can be fixed very easily then I would still call it a great deal. Life is a game of adjustment !!! and I actually bring into practice each and every time...I faced only 2 issues with phone:1) The battery door was old, appeared to be used2) The wall charger was not working.I replied to seller and he promptly sent replacement parts for above things.Many people receive the phone unlocked and think that just inserting the SIM card should make it work for GSM, if the phone does not works or if they see Activation Required message then they start complaining. Even in worst case, the phone is locked you can get unlock code on-line from free to about 30$ (it all depends on the urgency). On this I would say, the seller is good enough as they send me the unlock code when asked for. After unlocking, I easily switched to GSM and removed the activation required message.For any help please type in following in youtube:"How to Unlock Blackberry Bold 9650 Unlocking Remotely by Code Verizon AT&T; T-Mobile | CellUnlock.net""disable activation required Blackberry storm 9500 9530"

Reviews.Title: Warning!
Reviews.Author: Ranga Damodaran "RD"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone recently. While the website claims that the phone will be shipped with instructions, none were in the box. Also, and more importantly, the Amazon website does not mention anything about a 7 day return policy. I had to travel on business so I did not get around to activating the phone. When I returned and tried to activate the phone, I realized there were no instructions which made me run around to the cell phone stores trying to get the unit working. When I tried to return the phone, the company drew my attention to the invoice which states a 7 day return policy. Anyone contemplating buying this phone should be aware of this. I spent $199 on the phone and have no recourse.

Reviews.Title: I should have known better
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: Having had a Blackberry Curve previously, and being frustrated with it, I should've known better when I upgraded to the 9650. Right out of the box, the trackpad button was installed crooked. I took it back immediately and was told by the Sprint technician, "yup, it's crooked, nothing we can do about it, RIM shipped thousands like that". And so began nearly a year of frustration with this deeply flawed device. Six months into using it, the device suddenly began turning itself off for no reason, usually just when I was using the browser. I took it back for repair, and they marginally fixed it, though it continued to shut down on occasion. The crooked trackpad continued to impede navigation throughout my usage. When they upgraded the operating system during the shut-down repair, I had hoped for better performance. Instead, it just slowed the phone down even more. As I travel to rural areas often, I need a phone that can also function minimally as a web browser - and this is where this phone really fails. Mobile media pages load with excruciating slowness, if at all. The camera image quality is also very poor, and the rudimentary controls are clunky and primitive. After less than a year I had enough and purchased at full price an HTC Android phone, and love it. Clearly, RIM has no clue about the current smartphone paradigm; the Blackberry line is a thing of the past, and the 9650 is an overpriced piece of junk, useful only as a phone, and marginally for messaging. Buyer beware.

ProductInfo.Features:
BlackBerry smartphone with QWERTY keyboard; dual-network capable for 3G-enabled GSM access when traveling abroad
Bluetooth stereo music; microSD memory expansion to 16 GB; access to personal and corporate email
Included in the Box is : Phone, Battery, Charger, USB cable, Carrying Case, Wired Headset, CD & User Manual
For CDMA & GSM Use. To use on CDMA - Please check sellers notes for compatibility with Verizon or Sprint (does not work on both, there are two versions)
To use on GSM just insert SIM card such as At&t; , Tmobile etc.
In order to use the phone with a GSM SIM card You will need to change the settings on your phone, We will include Easy Step by step directions how to Change the settings,
We will also explain how to download the AT&T; and T-Mobile service Books to your Phone, in order to be able to get emails, surf the web etc.
